reporting-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

title.narrative: U.S.-Indo-Pacific Standards and Technology Cooperation Program (STCP)

description.narrative: Support the institution of international agreements and trade facilitation techniques to allow countries to exchange goods and services and make financial investments without fear of loss. This is done through supporting public and private sector efforts to participate effectively in international trade and investment agreements and institutions, implement international agreements, adjust to changing trade conditions, and take full advantage of trade and investment to generate economic growth and reduce poverty.

This award strives to support the institution of international agreements and trade facilitation techniques to allow countries to exchange goods and services and make financial investments without fear of loss. More specifically, this includes a USTDA funding is supporting the U.S.-Indo-Pacific Standards and Technology Cooperation Program (STCP), a series of 12 separate and distinct standards-focused workshops to be held in different countries throughout the Indo-Pacific region. The STCP is designed to support the Indo-Pacific Strategy by facilitating engagement between U.S. and Indo-Pacific industry and government representatives to ensure that decision-makers who develop and implement standards, testing protocols, and regulatory procedures in the region are informed of internationally accepted industry-led standards..

participating-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States
